results.title: Photosynthesis: The Biochemical process
results.brief_description: From the sun, to green plant, to chloroplasts to grana, this film focuses on the basic life-sustaining process of photosynthesis. The approach is experimental: paper, chromatography, variable lights, spectrophotometric analysis and re-creation of the experiments of Theodore Engelmann, and Melvin Calvin illustrate the physics and chemistry of the photosynthetic process.

results.title: Photosynthesis. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows how the application of the scientific method has revealed the mechanism by which green plants transform light energy into food. Controlled experiments test the photosynthesis process and shows how each components - light, carbon dioxide, water, and chloroplasts is essential. Also introduces several advanced concepts, such as the formation of intermediate compounds and the effect of different types of light.

results.title: Photosynthesis (3rd edition)
results.brief_description: Presents a series of basic experiments that explain the various processes of photosynthesis. Explains the elements of ATP and NADPH and discusses their importance to the photosynthetic process. Discusses current and future uses for the photosynthetic process in relation to the earth’s energy sources.

results.title: Photosynthesis
results.creator_credit: Michael Birch and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains how green plants transform light energy into food by the process of photosynthesis. Shows the process by which carbon dioxide and water - in the presence of light and chlorophyll - react to produce sugar and release oxygen.

results.title: Photons
results.creator_credit: Wallace Worsley, Stephen White and Physical Science Study Committee
results.brief_description: John King demonstrates particular like behaviours of light, using a photomultiplier and oscilloscope output to observe a weak intermittent light source.

results.title: Photography: the incisive art
results.creator_credit: Richard Moore, Robert Katz and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: Ansel Adams, American photographer, has achieved a rare degree of harmony between the work for his clients in commerce and industry, his own deep interest in nature and conservation, and his task of making photographs that are works of art. As an introduction to professional photography, for both the novice and the non-photographer, the film presents many original ideas, and gives a high goal to aim for.

results.title: Photography: how it works
results.brief_description: Animated film designed to introduce the basics of photography. Explains the relatinship between lens openings and shutter speeds, the way automatic cameras adjust to various light conditions and concepts such as depth of field. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Photographic memory: a portrait of Mervyn Bishop (A)
results.creator_credit: Warwick Thornton, Penny McDonald and Chili Films
results.brief_description: A documentary about the life and photography of Mervyn Bishop, one of Australia’s leading indigenous professional photographers who broke new ground during the 1960’s and 1970’s as a media photographer. Bishop’s extensive archive of photographs offer an invaluable document of aspects of Australian and Aboriginal life over the past 40 years.

results.title: Photographic design
results.brief_description: Host Brian Ratty explains and illustrates many tips about photographic design. He covers selecting the right tools, visualizing the best composition, and designing with light and colour.
